If replication lag is caused by an unusual spike of writes to the primary instance, the failover replica can usually catch up to the primary instance after the load decreases again. If replication lag is high but steady, you can delete the failover replica and recreate it. However, if the write load continues, and the replication lag continues to increase, you must take action.
<https://app.google.stackdriver.com/dashboards/7959934676744208339?project=acuit-0|Dashboard>

Latency from load balancer, proximity to client side latency, averaged over a day. It going over 20s would indicate long latency client is facing.

API Auth 5XX
Impact: This Auth endpoint is used by NextHub and CFC for user logins, 5XX on this will result in users unable to login. 
Where to look:
<https://app.google.stackdriver.com/dashboards/8547151250581959832?project=acuit-0|Developer API Dashboard>
<https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/viewer?project=acuit-0&minLogLevel=0&expandAll=false&customFacets&limitCustomFacetWidth=true&dateRangeStart=2018-11-19T04%3A42%3A36.938Z&dateRangeEnd=2018-11-19T05%3A42%3A36.938Z&interval=PT1H&resource=api&scrollTimestamp=2018-11-19T05%3A42%3A24.286073989Z&logName=projects%2Facuit-0%2Flogs%2Fauthentication-oidc&advancedFilter=resource.type%3D%22api%22%0AlogName%3D%22projects%2Facuit-0%2Flogs%2Fauthentication-oidc%22%0A|Log>
https://pwcnext.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ACUIT/pages

This alert checks the uptime of redis instances, which is used in user-management and nexthub-node-mw. 
Impact: If any of the redis instance is down, users will experiencing errors. Redis are supposed to be highly available. 
Where to look: Check the particular redis instance that's having problem.
Actions: Assess the failure, redis has self failover, if the whole cluster is down, start the emergency process. 

<https://pwcnext.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ACUIT/pages/27885720/Redis|Redis doco>
